column4: hey all. i am having an issue installing ubuntu to a usb stick. essentially using the usb stick as a hard drive. it installs fine but when i try boot from it the pc does not see an OS to boot from, despite setting the USb to boot in the bios. what could be the issue. note this is not a live persistent install, it's a normal install using the usb stick as a hard drive.  thanks

hmmm... another option might be usb-creator ..?

no, thats not it, you not understanding what I mean. i don't want a bootbale live cd on a usb stick. i want to use a sub stick as a hard drive, so boot up with cd, choose to install ubuntu to usb stick and boot off that

just ignore the fact that i'm using a usb stick and think of me installing ubuntu to a hard drivbe and the system won't see the os

ok... the only other thing i can think of is when you boot from usb, it gets the device names wrong. perhaps if you specified devices/partitions by uuid that would fix it?

in which case, sorry to say i think i'm out of ideas... see what your experiment in vmware yields....
